work.summary: Majesco creates web-based insurance solutions for clients across multiple insurance sectors. My role at Majesco is to ensure a quality product is delivered by my team. I lead daily scrums and manage a large team of developers, and also resolve critical production issues late in the sprint. Extra responsibilities include release delivery support, production support, and mentorship of new developers.

DRC creates web-based insurance solutions for internal usage among clients in the homeowners and motor vehicle space. Using the .NET framework in C# and Javascript, my role at DRC was primarily driving new implementations with a full-stack approach to expand the reach of the system. Through an agile methodology, my team and I delivered new features and upgrades to the system efficiently. Extra responsibilities include general production support and mentoring of new hires.

work.company: Curriculum Research & Development Group, College of Education
work.summary: CRDG is an organized research unit in the College of Education at the University of Hawai‘i Mānoa. Currently working on a research project funded by the National Science Foundation that is aimed at broadening the Native Hawaiian Engineering faculty at UHM. Also helped with Hawaii GenCyber 2016 and created course resources for teacher education.
highlights: Data collection and analysis, transcription and analysis, graphic design, producing educational resources, and general clerical work

work.summary: LAVA (Laboratory for Advanced Visualization/Applications) is a lab run by Jason Leigh, a professor and researcher at the University of Hawai‘i at Manoa. Using cutting-edge technologies like the CyberCANOE, the HTC Vive, the Microsoft Hololens, and more, the lab aims to create developments in big data visualization techniques. During my time there, I contributed to a variety of projects using Javascript skills, video making/editing skills, and transcription skills.
highlights: Created high-quality video documentation for SAGE2 technology
Contributed to development of SIEGE, a simple video game for the CreaTable coded only in Javascript
Transcribed lengthy clips for the Articulate project
